intro: Armeria stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thrift, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, coastal environments. Its small, pink or white flowers bloom in clusters, adding a delicate touch to its compact growth habit. Armeria stenophylla is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
